body:
> **Actual Behavior:** `abstractClassAssert1()` executes only once as instance of `Inner1` with a passing test.

That's rather interesting, because I see the opposite behavior: `abstractClassAssert1()` executes only once as instance of `Inner2` with a failing test.
What is the output when launched on the console? Via https://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#running-tests-console-launcher or Gradle or Maven/Surefire?
I've already got a Test Kit example in the works showing that only one of the nested test classes is executing. So I don't think the console launcher will work any differently. ðŸ˜‰

And here's the debug output for all events.

```
All Events:
	Event [type = STARTED, testDescriptor = JupiterEngineDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.571899Z, payload = null]
	Event [type = STARTED, testDescriptor = ClassTestDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:org.junit.platform.MainTest], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.572543Z, payload = null]
	Event [type = STARTED, testDescriptor = NestedClassTestDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:org.junit.platform.MainTest]/[nested-class:Inner2], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.573665Z, payload = null]
	Event [type = STARTED, testDescriptor = NestedClassTestDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:org.junit.platform.MainTest]/[nested-class:Inner2]/[nested-class:AbstractNested], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.574516Z, payload = null]
	Event [type = STARTED, testDescriptor = TestMethodTestDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:org.junit.platform.MainTest]/[nested-class:Inner2]/[nested-class:AbstractNested]/[method:abstractClassAssert1()], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.575301Z, payload = null]
	Event [type = FINISHED, testDescriptor = TestMethodTestDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:org.junit.platform.MainTest]/[nested-class:Inner2]/[nested-class:AbstractNested]/[method:abstractClassAssert1()], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.594138Z, payload = TestExecutionResult [status = FAILED, throwable = org.opentest4j.AssertionFailedError: expected: <fail> but was: <pass>]]
	Event [type = FINISHED, testDescriptor = NestedClassTestDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:org.junit.platform.MainTest]/[nested-class:Inner2]/[nested-class:AbstractNested], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.594992Z, payload = TestExecutionResult [status = SUCCESSFUL, throwable = null]]
	Event [type = FINISHED, testDescriptor = NestedClassTestDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:org.junit.platform.MainTest]/[nested-class:Inner2], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.595028Z, payload = TestExecutionResult [status = SUCCESSFUL, throwable = null]]
	Event [type = FINISHED, testDescriptor = ClassTestDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter]/[class:org.junit.platform.MainTest], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.595066Z, payload = TestExecutionResult [status = SUCCESSFUL, throwable = null]]
	Event [type = FINISHED, testDescriptor = JupiterEngineDescriptor: [engine:junit-jupiter], timestamp = 2019-07-10T15:21:39.595241Z, payload = TestExecutionResult [status = SUCCESSFUL, throwable = null]]
```

Class `Inner1` doesn't show up anywhere.
Tentatively slated for 5.6 M1 since this appears to be a bug.

issue.title: Introduce API to select and execute individual tests in inherited nested classes

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
Such an API is necessary for tools to be able to run individual tests, when such tests are defined in a nested class of a (possibly abstract) super-class of the test class. See:

* https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-195373
* https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-215440

## Deliverables

I won't pretend to know how this should be done. Perhaps @akozlova has ideas.

issue.title: Fix discovery of inherited nested classes

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
The discovery algorithm introduced in 5.5 remembers already the
resolution of each discovery selector. Prior to this commit, nested
classes were resolved by adding a ClassSelector for the nested class.
If that ClassSelector has been resolved before, discovery is assumed to
be finished. Similarly, when resolving MethodSelectors for methods
within a nested test class that have been resolved before, discovery
will stop.

This commit introduces dedicated selectors for nested classes and their
methods which take into account the actual enclosing classes that will
be present at runtime. These selectors are package-private for now but
could be made publicly available in a future release.

Fixes #1954.

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass
